definition: (usually followed by `to' or `for') on the point of or strongly disposed, put into a certain state, several exercises intended to be done in series
details:
adjective
- (usually followed by `to' or `for') on the point of or strongly disposed
= synonyms: fit
- being below the horizon
- converted to solid form (as concrete)
= synonyms: hardened
- fixed and unmoving
= example: fixed and unmoving
= synonyms: fixed
- set down according to a plan:'a carefully laid table with places set for four people'
= synonyms: laid
- situated in a particular spot or position
= synonyms: placed, located, situated
- determined or decided upon as by an authority
= synonyms: determined
verb
- put into a certain state
- make ready or suitable or equip in advance for a particular purpose or for some use, event, etc
= synonyms: ready
- get ready for a particular purpose or event
= example: get ready for a particular purpose or event
= synonyms: set up, lay out
- equip with sails or masts
= synonyms: rig
- become gelatinous
= synonyms: jell, congeal
- estimate
= synonyms: put
- fix conclusively or authoritatively
= example: fix conclusively or authoritatively
= synonyms: determine
- decide upon or fix definitely
= synonyms: fix
- establish as the highest level or best performance
= example: establish as the highest level or best performance
= synonyms: mark
- urge to attack someone
= synonyms: sic
- give a fine, sharp edge to a knife or razor
- put into a certain place or abstract location
= synonyms: put
- insert (a nail or screw below the surface, as into a countersink)
= synonyms: countersink
- put or set (seeds, seedlings, or plants) into the ground

- fix in a border
= example: fix in a border
- put into a position that will restore a normal state
= example: put into a position that will restore a normal state
- apply or start
= example: apply or start
- adapt for performance in a different way
= example: adapt for performance in a different way
= synonyms: arrange
- locate
= example: locate

- set in type
= example: set in type

- disappear beyond the horizon
= example: disappear beyond the horizon
= synonyms: go down, go under
- arrange attractively

- bear fruit
= synonyms: fruit, fructify
- alter or regulate so as to achieve accuracy or conform to a standard

- set to a certain position or cause to operate correctly
= example: set to a certain position or cause to operate correctly
noun
- several exercises intended to be done in series
= example: several exercises intended to be done in series

- the act of putting something in position
= example: the act of putting something in position
- any electronic equipment that receives or transmits radio or tv signals
= example: any electronic equipment that receives or transmits radio or tv signals
- representation consisting of the scenery and other properties used to identify the location of a dramatic production
= example: representation consisting of the scenery and other properties used to identify the location of a dramatic production
= synonyms: stage set
- (psychology) being temporarily ready to respond in a particular way
= example: (psychology) being temporarily ready to respond in a particular way

- a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way
= example: a relatively permanent inclination to react in a particular way
= synonyms: bent
- the descent of a heavenly body below the horizon
= example: the descent of a heavenly body below the horizon
- a group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used
= example: a group of things of the same kind that belong together and are so used
- (mathematics) an abstract collection of numbers or symbols
= example: (mathematics) an abstract collection of numbers or symbols
- an unofficial association of people or groups
= example: an unofficial association of people or groups
= synonyms: circle
- the process of becoming hard or solid by cooling or drying or crystallization
= synonyms: hardening
- a unit of play in tennis or squash
= example: a unit of play in tennis or squash
